Package Game.Items

Class Pistol

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.StaticBody
Game.Items.Pistol
public class Pistol
extends city.cs.engine.StaticBody

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Pistol​(GameLevel level)
    This constructor creates a visual Pistol object on the map It gets destroyed after the collision (pick up) is detected This constructs pistol object on the map, after picked it gets destroyed and abstract pistol gets created
    Pistol​(GameLevel gameLevel, boolean picked)
    This constructor creates an abstract Pistol object which will allow the character to shoot.
    Pistol​(GameLevel gameLevel, int ammo)
    Constructor created for creating new Pistol when new level is loaded. the ammo stat is going to be read from file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Pistol

      public Pistol​(GameLevel gameLevel, boolean picked)
      This constructor creates an abstract Pistol object which will allow the character to shoot. It's created because when picked up (collided) the CollisionDetector calls for destroy().
      Parameters:
      gameLevel - The world that the pistol object is created in
      picked - Sets picked value to true

    • Pistol

      public Pistol​(GameLevel gameLevel, int ammo)
      Constructor created for creating new Pistol when new level is loaded. the ammo stat is going to be read from file.

    • Pistol

      public Pistol​(GameLevel level)
      This constructor creates a visual Pistol object on the map It gets destroyed after the collision (pick up) is detected This constructs pistol object on the map, after picked it gets destroyed and abstract pistol gets created
      Parameters:
      level - The world that the pistol object is created in

    • getShootSound

      public city.cs.engine.SoundClip getShootSound()
      Returns:
      The SoundClip that represents shooting

    • setAmmo

      public void setAmmo​(int addAmmo)
      Set the ammo of a pistol [by finding ammo crate or killing an enemy]
      Parameters:
      addAmmo - the amount of ammo that will be added to the ammo field

    • updateVolume

      public void updateVolume​(float sfcVol)

    • shoot

      public void shoot​(GameLevel level, city.cs.engine.Walker db, float charHeight, float gap, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 mouseDir, java.lang.String bulletName)
      Shooting method
      Parameters:
      bulletName - specifies the name of the bullet that's being shot (Enemy Bullet, MC bullet etc)
      charHeight - the height of the character so that the bullet will be placed next to the character, not in it
      db - the walker object
      mouseDir - position of the click, to set the direction of the buller
      level - World object needed to create the bullet
